questions.question: Which tense is used to describe an action that will be in progress at a specific time in the time to come?
questions.explanation: Future continuous tense is used to describe actions that will be ongoing at a specific time in the future.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The children _______ (play) in the garden when it started to rain.
questions.explanation: This sentence requires past continuous tense to show an action that was ongoing in the past when another action occurred.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses present continuous tense?
options: a) I reading a book right now.
b) She is cook dinner at the moment.
c) They are watching a movie.
d) We studying for the exam.
questions.explanation: This sentence correctly uses the structure 'are + verb-ing' to show an action happening now.

questions.question:
Fill in the blank according to the past continuous tense:
The students _______ (work) on their projects all week.
questions.explanation: This sentence requires past continuous tense to show an action that was ongoing throughout a past time.

questions.question: Which sentence correctly uses future continuous tense?
options: a) We will travelling to Europe next summer.
b) She will be studying at the library tomorrow evening.
c) They will cooking dinner when we arrive.
d) I will be go to the gym every morning.
questions.explanation: This sentence correctly uses the structure 'will be + verb-ing' to show a future ongoing action.

questions.question: What is the present continuous form of 'The wind blows'?
options: c) The wind will be blowing
questions.explanation: Present continuous uses 'is + verb-ing' for third-person singular subjects.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: At this time next month, we _______ (hike) in the mountains.
questions.explanation: This requires future continuous to describe an action that will be in progress at a specific future time.

questions.question: Which sentence uses present continuous correctly for a changing situation?
options: b) The climate is changing at an alarming rate.
c) Sea levels rise every year.
questions.explanation: Present continuous can be used to describe changing or developing situations.

questions.question: What is the past continuous form of 'They sing'?
questions.explanation: Past continuous uses 'were + verb-ing' for plural subjects.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Look! The baby _______ (smile) at us.
questions.explanation: This requires present continuous to describe an action happening right now.

questions.question: Which tense is used to describe a later action that will be in progress when another action occurs?
questions.explanation: Future continuous can be used to describe a future ongoing action that will be interrupted by another action.

questions.question: What is the future continuous form of 'I teach'?
questions.explanation: Future continuous uses 'will be + verb-ing' to describe a future ongoing action.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: When I arrived at the party, everyone _______ (dance).
questions.explanation: This requires past continuous to describe an ongoing action in the past when another action occurred.

questions.question: Which sentence uses present continuous correctly for a temporary situation?
options: a) I live in New York.
b) She works as a teacher.
c) They are staying with us until their house is ready.
d) We go to the beach every summer.
questions.explanation: Present continuous can be used to describe temporary situations.

questions.question: What is the present continuous form of 'He writes'?
questions.explanation: Present continuous uses 'is + verb-ing' for third-person singular subjects.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: This time next week, I _______ (present) my research at the conference.
questions.explanation: This requires future continuous to describe an action that will be ongoing at a specific time in the future.

questions.question: Which sentence uses past continuous correctly?
options: a) She was cook dinner when the phone rang.
b) They were played football all afternoon.
c) I was reading a book when the power went out.
d) We were eat lunch when you called.
questions.explanation: This sentence correctly uses 'was + verb-ing' to describe an ongoing action in the past.

questions.question: What is the future continuous form of 'She runs'?
questions.explanation: Future continuous uses 'will be + verb-ing' to describe a future ongoing action.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: While he _______ (wait) for the train, he met an old friend.
questions.explanation: This requires past continuous to describe an ongoing action in the past during which another action occurred.

questions.question: Fill in the blank according to the present continuous tense: The flowers _______ (grow) quickly in this warm weather.
questions.explanation: This requires present continuous to describe an ongoing action or process happening around the present time.

questions.question: Which sentence uses future continuous correctly?
options: a) We will be visit our grandparents next weekend.
b) She will working on her project all day tomorrow.
c) They will be moving to a new house next month.
d) I will be go to the gym every morning starting next week.
questions.explanation: This sentence correctly uses 'will be + verb-ing' to describe a future ongoing action.

questions.question: What is the present continuous form of 'The leaves fall'?
options: c) The leaves will be falling
questions.explanation: Present continuous uses 'are + verb-ing' for plural subjects.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: By the time you arrive, we _______ (finish) the meeting.
questions.explanation: This requires future continuous to describe an action that will be ongoing at a specific point in the future.

questions.question: Which tense is used to set the background in a story?
questions.explanation: Past continuous is often used to set the background or describe ongoing actions in a story set in the past.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: When I saw him, he _______ (run) to catch the bus.
questions.explanation: This requires past continuous to describe an ongoing action observed in the past.
